alert.note: Alert for Santa Barbara County Mountains; Santa Barbara County South Coast (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Watch issued December 13 at 11:46AM PST until December 14 at 12:00PM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WATCH FOR THE ALISAL BURN SCAR NOW IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM PST THIS EVENING THROUGH NOON PST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Flash flooding and debris flows caused by excessive rainfall continue to be possible over the Alisal burn scar. Rainfall rates locally up to one inch per hour will be possible. * WHERE...The Alisal burn scar in Santa Barbara county. * WHEN...From 6 PM PST this evening through noon PST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Heavy rainfall over the Alisal burn scar is expected during the watch period. Residents near the Alisal burn scar should prepare for potential flash flooding and debris flow impacts. Be sure to stay up to date with information from local authorities. Heavy rainfall could trigger flash flooding of low-lying areas, urbanized street flooding, and debris flows in and near the Alisal burn scar. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - National Weather Service Meteorologists are forecasting heavy rainfall over the burn scar, which may lead to flash flooding and debris flows. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: A Flash Flood Watch means that conditions may develop that lead to flash flooding and debris flows. Flash flooding is a VERY DANGEROUS SITUATION.

area.areaDesc: Santa Barbara County Mountains; Santa Barbara County South Coast
